newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Details of proposed changes to Tractebel statutes.
newsitem.headline: Details of proposed changes to Tractebel statutes.

text.p: Belgian holding company Ste Generale de Belgique (SGB) said on Tuesday it would propose several changes to the statutes of its Tractebel SA unit to guarantee its independence.

The proposals are in reaction to worries in Belgium that the expansion of utility group Tractebel would be curbed by the planned merger of Cie de Suez, SGB's French parent company, with French utility group Lyonnaise des Eaux.
SGB, which owns 65 percent of Tractebel's capital, said in a statement that it would propose to Tractebel's board the following changes to the articles of association:
- the number of directorships held by any one shareholder may not exceed half the total directors less one; at least one third of the members of the board must be independent directors;
- the board of directors will set up a Strategy Committee consisting of seven of its members -- of which three will be independent -- and the Chairman of the Management Committee.
The mission of this Committee, which prepares board meetings, will be defined in the articles of association;

- the Strategy Committee will lay down the procedure for dealing with potential conflicts of interest between the Tractebel group and any company associated with the controlling shareholder, which operates in the same or a similar field;
- a qualified majority will be required at an Extraordinary General Meeting to approve any changes to the provisions set above.
"The proposals put forward by SGB give a clear signal to the markets, where Tractebel will of course continue to be listed as an independent company," the SGB statement said.
